reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This could have been a difficult review to write. For the first day Savill Court fell into a 'safe mediocrity'; not worthy of criticism, but lacking the 'va va voom' to praise it. It is a very large hotel and as such everything came over a little bit impersonal. But, read on - it got better.
reviews.title: It grows on you...

reviews.text: We booked a 3 day chill break and upgraded to a 'feature room'. After an exhausting work schedule we just wanted to relax. On arrival we doubled checked that we had a 'feature room' at reception with a girl who we found very difficult to understand, but we when we got to our room it could only be described as a 'feature-less room'. Back to reception and this time the manager re-allocated us one of their 4 poster bed rooms (240).
reviews.title: Second to None

reviews.text: 240 was clean, quite roomy with nice views and good supplies of tea and coffee. It had a bit of a small en-suite, a good bed, not-so-good pillows, but overall was good value. Nothing was too much trouble for the housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: 1st Class Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located amongst rambling mansions now owned mainly by Russians. The staff in the bar and restaurant reflected this and we felt they were a little frosty, although always polite, on the first day. We were wrong; by the third night, the staff really opened up and were very amusing and friendly despite the fact they had to deal with three weddings while were there.
reviews.title: Wedding Bells - No it was the clanging of crockery in the next room

reviews.text: The weddings didn't interfere with our stay at all as the Savill is so huge. In fact quite the opposite. The guests all seemed to be very relaxed and friendly and I even bumped into a long-lost cousin from the north at one of them! If you are planning a wedding there, I think it will work well no matter how big or small as most of the staff seemed to really enjoy them and were very professional at all times. It is clearly an excellent venue for a conference too.
reviews.title: Good Location, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Negatives:Came to stay on business for a four days.No signal in or around the hotel I had to drive away from the hotel to make my business calls.TheInternet connection was very slow and not wireless.Not enough public areas to sit in just a very dark bar.The jacuzzi didn't work. No airconditioning in the room, extremely hot and uncomfortable.Breakfast was £17.00 per head Glas of wine with soada £5.25, Too formal in restaurant asked if everything was ok with the meal by two different members of staff on every course So many wasps outside impossible to eat or drink without them either landing on my meal and even on the stem of my wine glass at one point.Death trap floor around the swimming pool.
reviews.title: Disappointed Female traveller on business

reviews.text: Positive:
reviews.title: OK by conference hotel standards

reviews.text: Friendly helpful staff, spotlessly clean,nice setting
reviews.title: Lovely Weekend

reviews.text: There is nothing major wrong with the Savill Court. However, people booking it believing that they are in for some English Country House hotel style and luxury will be very disappointed. Whilst the exterior of the hotel is impressive, the interior is modern, bland and unimpressive. In particular, the carpet is a really nasty lime green and yellow swirly affair and the lighting is cheap fluorescent spotlights. There is no atmosphere to the place, beyond that you would find in a conference centre.
reviews.title: Fantastic place, Will be going back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a place to sleep it is perfectly fine, with nice rooms and bathrooms. Service at reception is efficient. Breakfast was only OK, with patchy service.
reviews.title: Anniversary to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 2.5 months in advance to attend a wedding.
reviews.title: Lacking. Oh and no mobile phone reception in the rooms.

reviews.text: First Impressions
reviews.title: Family Fun

reviews.text: Clean lobby, nice taxi journry from Egham station. Receptionist Katie was lovely - the best member of staff in the hotel. OK check in.
reviews.title: What a Stay

reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: lovely setting

reviews.text: I booked an executive double, or so I thought. Bed was very small, smaller than a double bed. Room size was tolerable. Bathroom was a nice size. Pillows were awful, throw was itchy, mattress very uncomfortable so had two rough nights. The toilet was NOT clean on arrival! I was so shocked I took a photo.
reviews.title: Hot for all the right Reasons

reviews.text: This hotel has been recently renovated so it may be different than what you remember or have read. The rooms are nice but small for American standards and there was no air conditioning, but you could open the large windows (if on an outside facing room). The location is very near Windsor. The train station is about 10 minutes drive, so you do need a car if you are staying here or depend on a taxi. There is a pool and workout facility which is also very nice but only open from 7AM-8PM, not ideal if you want to workout very early or late. Bathrooms are small, but I just chalk that up to the English charm. Definitely stay here if you want to get a taste of the UK lifestyle, if not than stay at the Marriott.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Sixteen hours of hell!!
reviews.text: Stayed 12 May after taking sixteen year old son and friend to Twickenham to watch rugby thought we would spoil ourselves with nice overnight stay having travelled down from Chester. What can I say apart from do not go! room 107 next to fridge generators asked to be moved as wall and floor were vibrating only had single room left so husband stayed in 107 and I took single more on that later...... Went for dinner at 8pm came away at 11pm service was so slow had to ask for wine twice, soup like dishwater, crusty skin on tartare sauce, bread before starter and then not offered any more until half way through main course!! what was the point of that! Dessert was inedible and disgusting heated up in the microwave. Restaurant manager asked my husband if he had enjoyed his meal to which he replied "I have had better" and listed all the faults, manager suggested we might "like a drink on him" we refused.
Large party in "Great Hall" they had visit from a stage act dressed as SAS men complete with guns and screams and shouting - nice when you are trying to enjoy a nice quite dinner.
reviews.title: Miserable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And so to bed ha ha by the time I got to my single room (128) the party was in full swing, complained about noise to be told "sorry madam party on until 2pm". Back to room 107 which by comparison seemed quieter until 4.45 when gave up and went back to single room, room was cold could not do window up as catch was broken and due to the fact that it was straight out onto a flat roof had to wake husband to come and see if he could shut it, which he did with a pair of scissors! just got to sleep and was awoken by loud thump on investigation fire escape information had been stuck on the back of the door with glue and had slid to floor! this hotel really is a joke.
reviews.title: Not as bad as expected

reviews.text: Only good thing I can say is breakfast was good lots of selection and a good english cooked breakfast.
reviews.title: Attractive hotel - service needs a little work

likes.liked: — Very newly updated and well equipped

reviews.text: i just wanted to be away from a busy office life and ithink i got athe right place. A very beautiful and classic location...............
reviews.title: Fantastic..................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at reception was very helpful and gave me a room over viewing the beautiful garden.the room was very confortable and excellent cleaning standard.. the breakfast was really good in short it was a very confortable stay and defenitely i will come back to savill court
reviews.title: Splendid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my wife here as a break from the kids. We where impressed when we arrived at the hotel and where greeted by the old style building the presented its self at the end of the long drive. We checked in and went to our room to off load our luggage. We where pleasantly surprised when we got there as the room was gorgeous. We spend some time in the pool and leisure spa just relaxing which was a treat. Dinner was fantastic and the lady who served us was superb. We ended the evening with a night cap in the bar. The following morning we asked reception if there was somewhere we could stretch our legs and they recommended having a walk down to the Windsor Great Park. We did this and stopped at the Fox & Hound on the way back which was good as well. We had a nice relaxing stay and managed to recharge our batteries. I’m sure we will be back
reviews.title: Promises much, delivers little

reviews.text: Myself and my partner booked a half price package at Savill Court through last minute for £50. The room we were given on first arrival as tiny and had a window that looked out onto an air conditioning unit. We complained and were told that there was a wedding on so there were limited rooms. The second room we were shown had a loose halogen bulb hanging from a socket, a miniscule bathroom, a waterstained ceiling and a stained pillow. Finally the third room we were allocated was ok. And I stress ok considering this room was meant to cost £100 full price.
reviews.title: Fantastic
A relaxing stay
reviews.text: The internet connection didn't work and the TV wasn't tuned in properly.
